title: Actor-Network Analysis for Enhancing Live Online Education Efficiency

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning platforms and foundational knowledge of educational planning
context.additional_context: Most learners perform manager/leader roles and require intermediate-level education to strengthen social sector job competencies, operating with summative assessments in non-real-time learning environments using personal devices

learning_goals: Applying Actor-Network Theory, factors influencing the efficiency of live online education can be classified into three or more categories
By analyzing interactions among diverse actors—such as hardware/software, learners/instructors, and session design—improvement strategies for educational quality can be proposed
Based on qualitative analysis results, online education design strategies tailored to specific educational contexts can be established
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
